{{lowercase}} {{Infobox Software | name = remastersys | logo = [[Image:remastersys.png|80px]] | screenshot = [[Image:Remastersys-zorinos.png|200px]] | caption = | collapsible = | author = Tony Brijeski (aka Fragadelic) | developer = Tony Brijeski | released = | latest release version = 2.0.18-1 (Debian); 2.0.16-1 (Ubuntu) | latest release date = {{release date|2010|04|18}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = | programming language = [[GNU bash|Bash]] | operating system = [[Debian]] / [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] | platform = [[Linux kernel|Linux]] | size = | language = English | status = activehttp://www.remastersys.com/ | genre = | license = [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL Version 2]] | website = [http://www.remastersys.com/ remastersys.com] }} '''remastersys''' is a [[free software|free]] and [[open source]] program for [[Debian]], [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]-based, or derivative software systems that can: * Create a customized Live CD/DVD (a [[Software remastering|remaster]]) of [[Debian]] and its derivatives. * Back up an entire system, including user data, to an installable [[Live CD|Live CD/DVD]]. After a brief period of stopping development it has been made active again.http://www.remastersys.com/ ==History== It was initially created to be able to easily back up or create a distributable copy of an Ubuntu or derivative installation. Inspiration for this tool came from the [[mklivecd]] script that Mandriva uses and the remasterme script that is in PCLinuxOS. Since those scripts were not very easy to port to Ubuntu, it was written from scratch. ==Uses== remastersys is intended to serve as an easy way to create a customized Live CD/DVD version of Ubuntu. The resulting [[ISO image|iso]] can also be installed on a USB pendrive, creating a [[Live USB]] distro, using either a command-line approach{{citeweb|title=Ubuntu 8.04 USB Hard Drive install|url=http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2008/04/14/ubuntu-804-usb-hard-drive-install/|publisher=pendrivelinux.com|accessdate=2008-04-20}} or a graphical tool such as [[UNetbootin]]. It has a command line version and a [[GUI]] version.
